content:
Here is an outline for a Typeform that uses logic to onboard a radio show host at a community radio station:

1. Personal Information:
* First Name (required)
* Last Name (required)
* Personal Email (required)
2. Radio Kingston Email:
* Would you like a Radio Kingston Email? (Yes/No question)
	+ If "Yes", ask for:
		- Desired Radio Kingston Email Address (required)
		- Will you use your new Radio Kingston Email as your best method of contacting you? (Yes/No question)
3. Contact Information:
* Phone Number (required)
* Address (required)
* City (required)
* State (required)
* Zip Code (required)
4. Clothing Sizes:
* T-Shirt Size (optional)
* Hoodie Size (optional)
5. Onboarding Documents:
* Onboarding Document 1 (required)
* Onboarding Document 2 (required)
* Onboarding Document 3 (required)
6. Show Information:
* Show Name (required)
* Show Start Date (required)
* Resource Page Information (required)

Note: The form should have a submit button at the end, which when clicked, will send all the filled information to the community radio station.

As an additional note, to make the form more user-friendly, it's a good idea to use appropriate input types (e.g. email, phone number) to make it easy for the user to fill out the form.
Also, you may want to consider adding a captcha to prevent spam submissions.
You can use the logic function of Typeform to make the form interactive and make certain fields appear based on the previous answers.
